fundacion.content_1: For generations, it was a minor family of the landed gentry, comfortable in mediocrity and submissive to more powerful houses in exchange for crumbs of influence. Their great-grandfather achieved a brief glimmer of prominence during the dawn of the First Industrial Revolution, but the general decline of England dragged the Reaventhorns back into obscurity. By the time Norland was born, the family had been reduced to sycophantic courtiers, lapdogs in the drawing rooms of those who truly held power.
fundacion.content_2: This inherited humiliation marked Norland from childhood. A particularly demeaning episode during a banquet at the Harringtons' manor, where his father was treated with condescending scorn, sealed within the young man a deep disdain for his lineage and an ironclad determination never again to depend on the mercy of others. Following the death of his parents, Norland abandoned the surname and the decaying English aristocracy, departing for the African colonies as the right-hand man of a mining tycoon with no heirs.
fundacion.content_3: There, far from the shackles of tradition, his cold mind and relentless will found their true element. Overseeing the mining exploitation with an iron fist and quelling revolts, he internalised that power was a conquest, not a legacy. The fortune and mining concessions he inherited following a series of "tragic accidents" that eliminated his mentor's family provided the resources. But the true catalyst was the discovery of Aevar in his African mines. Norland did not see a mere mineral; he saw the instrument to rewrite the destiny of his family and of England. He returned, claimed leadership of the moribund House Reaventhorn and transformed it, from a family of second-raters, into the nucleus of the conspiracy that would give birth to an empire.

papel.title: Role in the overthrow
papel.content_1: Using the newly revitalised House Reaventhorn as a façade and centre of operations, he personally wove the web of alliances, sabotage, and manipulation that shattered the foundations of the United Kingdom. His masterstroke was the recruitment of House Lovelace, the guardians of the Royal Family, a move that turned the monarchy's protector into its executioner, granting him total access and privileged information.
papel.content_2: From the shadows of his residence in Yorkshire, Norland orchestrated every phase of the controlled collapse: the industrial sabotage, the financial panic, the disinformation. He coordinated the Twelve Houses like an orchestral conductor, ensuring that every failure seemed natural, every crisis, inevitable. The dinner in Yorkshire was not a negotiation, but the final staging of his play. There, with the Royal Family held prisoner and the country's elites as forced witnesses, Norland materialised the definitive rupture. His personal execution of Queen Victoria, synchronised with the final chime of Big Ben, was not an act of rage, but a calculated symbol: the old order died at the exact hour the new one was born. The Reaventhorns, from being lapdogs, became the founding regicides.

funcion.title: Function in the Empire
funcion.content_1: They are the enforcing will of the imperial project and the ultimate arbiters of power. They oversee and moderate the actions of the other eleven Founding Houses from the Imperial Council, guaranteeing that Norland's vision permeates every decision, every law, every spark of steam. They are the unbreakable nexus between the miraculous mineral and the destiny of the Empire, the custodians of the doctrine that holds that progress, order, and efficiency are the only gods worth serving. In their hands lies the authority to interpret and apply his mentality, the principle that justifies any means to ensure the perpetuity of the Empire.

valores.title: Family Values
valores.content_1: The Reaventhorns revere power, not as a hedonistic end, but as the fundamental and sole tool for sculpting reality. They believe that the will, when sufficiently cold and resolute, can bend even the laws of nature, as demonstrated by Aevar.
valores.content_2: They value efficiency and differential competence above all else. They despise incompetence and blind loyalty without practical utility. For them, sentimentalism, vague blood ties, and nostalgia are weaknesses that corrode the foundations of order. Their loyalty is a cold and calculated concept; one is loyal to Norland's imperial project because it is the logical and supreme embodiment of progress, not out of familial or emotional obligation. Merit, strategy, and foresight are the only virtues they recognise.

info.title: Key Information
info.content_1: Norland's Hidden Plan: Even for the Imperial Council, Norland is an enigma who calculates moves several steps ahead of everyone else. It is rumoured that he manages the Empire with a final goal that transcends mere world conquest, a secret objective linked to the very limits of Aevar which is being developed in the deepest and most heavily guarded laboratories of the Empire.
info.content_2: The Illicit Heir: The youngest of the Lovelaces, publicly recognised as the son of Lord Alistair Lovelace, is in reality the scion of the secret romance between Norland and Lady Eleanor Lovelace. This young man, named Cornelius, is unaware of his true parentage but is observed with a peculiar and distant attention by the Emperor.
info.content_3: The Sword of Damocles: Norland is fully aware of the contained hatred professed by his nephew, Leonard Reaventhorn, whose father he executed. However, in a display of Machiavellian confidence, he not only tolerates him but values and respects the young man's formidable capacity as a soldier, seeing in his cold and disciplined anger an exceptional instrument that, for now, serves the designs of the Empire to perfection.
info.content_4: The Frozen Fracture: The execution of Eldric Reaventhorn, Norland's younger brother, was not a mere act of repression. It was the ritual purging of the only moral opposition that could cause Norland himself to hesitate. His ghost, though erased from the records, persists as the only crack in the Emperor's absolutist will, a price he calculated and accepted to pay.

biografia.title: Biography
biografia.content_1: Norland Reaventhorn was born into the bosom of minor nobility whose name weighed less than its debts. From his youth, his sharp intellect and cold determination clashed against the glass ceiling of his lineage. His education at Oxford not only endowed him with an exceptional command of engineering and political economy but also revealed to him, with brutal clarity, the structural limitations of a monarchy anchored in sentimentalism and tradition. The submissive attitude of his father, who accepted with resignation the role of lapdog to more powerful houses, bred in Norland a deep contempt for his family's condition and boundless ambition.
biografia.content_2: Following the death of his parents, he abandoned a surname he associated with weakness and departed for the African colonies as the executive assistant to a mining tycoon. There, in an environment where life was just another resource and the law was imposed by the strongest, his character was tempered once and for all. He learned that power is not begged for; it is taken. That authority is exercised with an iron fist or not exercised at all. The fortune and vast mining concessions he inherited following the mysterious and timely disappearance of his mentor were not a stroke of luck, but the first calculated fruit of his will. This capital allowed him to return to England and claim what he considered his by right of capability: the leadership of House Reaventhorn.
biografia.content_3: But his true vision crystallised with the discovery of Aevar. In that mineral of opalescent sheen and colossal power, Norland did not see a simple commercial advantage. He saw the soul of a new world. The catalyst capable of fusing the iron of industry with the iron will of a leader, to forge an unstoppable order. From that moment, his biography ceased to be that of a man to become that of the architect of an empire.

filosofia.title: Philosophy and Vision
filosofia.content_1: To him, concepts such as tradition, mercy, or blood-inherited rights are nothing more than superstitions that obstruct the path of progress. He believes that history is an imperfect machine, and that its only legitimate purpose is to be redesigned by minds lucid enough and wills strong enough.
filosofia.content_2: His vision of the Empire of Aevora is that of a perfectly hierarchised and mechanised social organism. A vast piece of engineering where every individual, from the emperor to the mine worker, is a cog with a specific function, lubricated by obedience and driven by the infinite energy of Aevar. In this worldview, individual freedom is a dangerous myth; true freedom is that experienced by the social machine when functioning without friction. His motto, "The Will that does not waver, reigns", sums up his creed: in the universe he has built, doubt is the only unforgivable sin.

fisico.title: Physical Appearance
fisico.content_1: Norland Reaventhorn possesses a presence that commands silence before a word is spoken. Standing between 1.80 and 1.85 metres tall with a powerful and athletic build, he embodies the fusion of physical strength with intellectual authority. His face, with chiselled features and a firm jawline, is a map of controlled severity, from which any trace of frivolous youth has vanished.
fisico.content_2: Norland's hair is ash-blond, and his eyes are of a blue so icy that, under certain light, they reveal unsettling and subtle reddish hues. However, what truly defines him is the mask of burnished steel and ebony that permanently covers the upper part of his face. More than a protection, this mask is a symbol, a declaration: it hides the eyes, considered the window to the soul, and transforms the man into an icon. His voice, metallic and measured, emerges from behind it with the precision of perfectly calibrated machinery. The mask stands as the final and insurmountable wall separating Norland, the individual of flesh and blood, from Norland, the living incarnation of the imperial will.

biografia.title: Biography
biografia.content_1: He grew up in the very same shadow of minor nobility as his brother Norland, but where the latter saw only humiliation and weakness, Eldric perceived dignity in modesty and worth in the traditions that wove the social fabric. His time at Oxford led him through the cloisters of moral philosophy and social sciences, not the engineering workshops. There he was nourished by the ideals of the Enlightenment, the concept of inalienable rights, and the belief in human perfectibility through ethical reason, not merely technical.
biografia.content_2: While Norland was away in Africa, forging himself under the yoke of naked power, Eldric remained in England, observing with growing alarm the social fracture caused by unchecked industrialisation. The death of his parents left him as the sole moral counterweight within his own family. He observed Norland's meteoric and sinister rise not with envy, but with deep dread. He recognised in Aevar not the miracle his brother proclaimed, but a narcotic for the collective conscience, a substance that promised power in exchange for the soul.
biografia.content_3: His opposition to the coup d'état and the nascent Empire was not an act of political rebellion, but of existential resistance. He did not covet a throne, but sought to defend the very idea of humanity he saw being sacrificed on the altar of efficiency. When Norland's words began to forge chains of steel and steam, Eldric's became the last whisper of conscience, circulating from hand to hand like seeds of a world that refused to die. His tragedy was not having challenged an emperor, but having reminded him that he was once a man.

filosofia.title: Philosophy and Vision
filosofia.content_1: Eldric Reaventhorn's philosophy was a militant humanism. He believed that the value of a society was measured not by its steel production or firepower, but by the degree of freedom, compassion, and justice it guaranteed to each of its members. For him, progress was a journey towards greater moral enlightenment and personal autonomy, not a race towards mechanical domination.
filosofia.content_2: He stood in frontal opposition to Norland's social determinism. Where his brother saw cogs, Eldric saw people; where Norland imposed functions. He considered technology, and Aevar in particular, as ambivalent tools; they could liberate man from brutalising labour or enslave him to a new and more sophisticated tyranny. His vision was of a future where the machine was at the service of humanity, to free up time for thought, art, and community, not to consume every instant in an infinite wheel of production. In the Empire of Aevora, he saw the nightmare realised, the inversion of this principle.

fisico.title: Physical Appearance
fisico.content_1: Eldric Reaventhorn was the distorted and human reflection of his brother. He shared a similar stature, around 1.80 metres, and an athletic build, although his was that of a walker and a thinker, not that of a soldier or an engineer. His strength was functional, not ostentatious. The family resemblance broke down in the crucial details: his hair, of a messier, more ash-blond, framed a face where Norland's severity was exchanged for a reflective melancholy and a deep fatigue.
fisico.content_2: His eyes, of the same familiar blue, completely lacked the unsettling reddish hues that Aevar imprinted on his brother's gaze. They were clear, direct, and sad, capable of conveying a disarming empathy. He rejected the oppressive aesthetic of the new imperial nobility. He wore simple, practical, and well-worn clothes, generally in muted tones: browns, dark greys, moss greens. He wore no insignia, no decorative cogs, nor any symbol of the new order. His appearance was that of a scholar, a deliberate anachronism in a world of steam and polished steel. This simplicity was not poverty, but a declaration of principles: a silent reminder that true authority needs no adornments, and that humanity must not disguise itself as a machine. At his execution, that very simplicity made him appear not as a fallen prince, but as a common man sacrificed, multiplying the power of his martyrdom.

biografia.title: Biography
biografia.content_1: Leonard Reaventhorn bears the weight of a surname that is at once a stigma and a crown of thorns. As the son of Norland's younger brother, he was born on the periphery of the power his uncle coveted. His childhood, shared with his twin siblings William and Sophia, was brutally cut short when his father led one of the first and bloodiest rebellions against the new regime. Leonard not only lost his parents to Norland's executing hand; he was a forced witness to how imperial pragmatism turned a family bond into a crime of treason. The Emperor's mercy, orchestrated by House Lovelace, was a subtler condemnation: the gilded exile of his siblings in a noble household and, for him, the choice to vanish into anonymity or infiltrate the beast that devoured his family.
biografia.content_2: He chose the third way, a masterstroke. At the age of fourteen, renouncing the Lovelace surname and the status of an adopted noble, he enlisted as one of the "Houseless". In the army, Norland's preferred instrument, Leonard found the perfect battlefield for his personal duel. He demonstrated an innate tactical talent and a coldness under fire that soon drew attention, replicating his uncle's strategic genius but devoid of his ideology. He rose to Sergeant at seventeen, not in spite of being stateless, but because his raw skill was a resource that even the staunchest nepotism could not ignore. His posting to the Eastern Front was not an exile, but the crucible where he would begin to forge the weapon that might one day turn against the heart of the Empire.

filosofia.title: Philosophy and Vision
filosofia.content_1: Leonard Reaventhorn does not have a philosophy; he has a mission, and everything else is a façade. His view of the world is binary and claustrophobic. On one side, the absolute preservation of his siblings, William and Sophia, the only vestiges of a world prior to Aevar and the sole vessels of his residual humanity. On the other, the methodical destruction of Norland and the system he erected. To achieve both ends, he has constructed an identity of iron: the perfect imperial soldier, loyal to the point of obsequiousness, efficient to the point of inhumanity.
filosofia.content_2: This front is his weapon and his armour. Every act of discipline, every mission accomplished with excess, every display of cold devotion, is another brick in the wall of trust he needs to bring down from within. He does not believe in the Empire, in Aevar, or in mechanical progress; he believes in calculation, in patience, and in the strength of contained hatred. His loyalty is a slow-acting poison, and his rise through the ranks, the syringe that will carry him to the jugular vein of power.
filosofia.content_3: At its core, his vision is of the world as a clockwork mechanism that must be dismantled piece by piece, starting with the master pendulum. Meanwhile, he protects his siblings not with visible affection, but with the strategic distance of a man who knows that any exposed weakness is a pressure point for the enemy.

fisico.title: Physical Appearance
fisico.content_1: Leonard Reaventhorn is the incarnation of martial utility, an instrument polished by service and singular purpose. Of average height, between 1.75 and 1.80 metres, he possesses an athletic and functional physique, sculpted by military rigour and lacking any ostentation. It is not the imposing build of Norland, but that of an efficient predator, where every muscle has a practical application in combat or survival.
fisico.content_2: His appearance is a careful balance between anonymity and forced distinction. His hair, a dark chestnut inherited from his mother and kept longer than regulations permit but always under control, is a tacit rejection of the dynastic blonde of the Reaventhorns. His face, with angular features and a pallor acquired in extreme climates and interminable watches, rarely shows anything beyond an impassive concentration.
fisico.content_3: But his eyes are the most revealing and ambiguous feature: of an intense brown, in certain light or moments of extreme tension, they hint at subtle and unsettling reddish hues. They are not the opalescent shine of a habitual consumer of refined Aevar, but a dull glimmer, like embers covered in ash, suggesting a different exposure, perhaps a slow internal combustion.
fisico.content_4: He wears the imperial uniform with impeccable but worn precision, without flashy decorations, as if his body were just another tool of the Empire, silently awaiting the moment when the tool might turn against the hand that wields it.

biografia.title: Biography
biografia.content_1: William and Sophia Reaventhorn, twins joined by the umbilical cord of trauma and beauty, are the ghost children of the failed revolt. Blood nephew and niece of the Emperor, but adopted children of House Lovelace by decree of a calculated mercy. Following the execution of their parents, they were torn from the skirts of the insurgency and transplanted into the very heart of the order that stifled it. Raised in the impeccable drawing rooms of the Lovelaces, they were granted every privilege except the truth; they were instilled with the notion that their parents' sacrifice was a necessary evil, a tragic but logical error on the path towards imperial progress.
biografia.content_2: In this hothouse of elegant lies, their genius found an unexpected refuge: music. William became a piano prodigy; Sophia, a virtuoso of the violin. The regime, which values precision above all else, celebrated their art as proof that excellence and beauty could flourish under the new order. Their concerts at the High Columns became State rituals, living demonstrations that Aevora was not only steam and violence, but also harmony and control. Unknowingly, they were transformed into the official musicians of their own tragedy, instruments tuned to play the symphony of imperial legitimacy.

filosofia.title: Philosophy and Vision
filosofia.content_1: William and Sophia's philosophy is a fragile and cultivated faith in order as a substitute for justice. Raised in the doctrine that chaos is the only true evil, they have embraced musical harmony as the supreme good. They do not harbour the incandescent rancour of Leonard; instead, they feel a vague and elegant melancholy, a yearning for a world of simpler sentiments that they intuit is lost, but which they never knew.
filosofia.content_2: Their vision is expressed through musical scores. To them, music is not an escape, but an exploration. It is the language through which they seek to decipher the humanity that the Empire systematically rationalises and represses. Every perfectly executed note is an attempt to connect with something essential and beautiful that they believe must still exist in the soul of the monster that adopted them. They are, at heart, unconscious idealists. They believe that their art can be a bridge, that the beauty they create can, drop by drop, soften the iron of the regime.

fisico.title: Physical Appearance
fisico.content_1: William possesses the elegant slenderness of one who dedicates his hours to contemplation and the keyboard, not the battlefield. Of average height, his bearing is upright yet fluid, that of a conductor containing the energy of the orchestra. His hair, of a lighter and ashier blonde than that of his siblings, falls with studied carelessness. His blue eyes, piercing and slightly distant, seem always to be listening to an inner music.
fisico.content_2: Sophia emanates a slender and ethereal grace. Her figure, petite but full of a tension ready to turn into movement, seems created to hold a violin. Her blonde hair, lustrous and always arranged in a complex yet practical manner, frames a face of fine features and contained expressiveness. Her eyes, of the same hereditary blue, hold a liquid depth that seems to capture and reflect the emotion of every note she plays.

fundacion.title: Foundation
fundacion.content_1: The Armstrongs were not born into nobility; they forged it with hammer and fire. Their origins lie deep in the foundries of Northern England, where generations of blacksmiths and hydraulic engineers perfected the art of taming brute force. The true leap to power came with William Armstrong, a visionary obsessed with efficiency and applied power. He founded the Elswick Ordnance Company not as a mere business, but as a temple to a new religion: that of supreme mechanical force. Under his command, it became the principal supplier of weaponry to the Royal Navy and the British Army, feeding the machines of the global empire.
fundacion.content_2: But William despised the bureaucratic mediocrity and corruption he saw in the War Office. He considered the old monarchical order, with its antiquated generals and parliamentary sluggishness, to be a brake on the true potential of martial engineering. When Norland Reaventhorn approached him, he did not offer gold or empty titles. He offered him what a weapons smith of his calibre truly craved: a limitless forge. The opportunity to redesign the art of war from its foundations, liberated from obsolete traditions and sentimental moralisms. Armstrong did not join a conspiracy; he enlisted in a technological crusade.

papel.title: Role in the Coup
papel.content_1: The Armstrongs were the arm of naked steel within the conspiracy. While other houses undermined the economy or poisoned information, Armstrong's secret workshops, hidden in the Welsh valleys and the docks of Newcastle, were already roaring with the first prototypes of compressed steam rifles and the embryonic blueprints of what would become the Guardians. Their role was one of industrial sabotage and preventive technical superiority.
papel.content_2: On the night of the coup, whilst chaos took hold of London, specialised teams of Armstrong technicians, dressed as maintenance workers, infiltrated key royal arsenals. They disabled artillery systems, contaminated gunpowder reserves, and secured coal depots, leaving the garrisons loyal to the Crown practically hamstrung. There was no need for great pitched battles; the war was won hours earlier, in the shadows, by men who knew every screw and every valve better than the soldiers who were meant to use them.

funcion.title: Function in the Empire
funcion.content_1: The Armstrongs are the Imperial Armourers, the blacksmiths of the new god of war. Their absolute dominion extends over the Forge Domains, vast industrial districts converted into factory-cathedrals dedicated exclusively to martial production. From the simplest steam rifle to the reactor of the Guardian Mark IV, every instrument of force that bears the Empire's seal has passed through their designs, their furnaces, and their testing benches.
funcion.content_2: Their function is to translate the raw and theoretical power of Aevar into realities of steel and fire. They oversee the entire chain: weaponry research, advanced metallurgy, mass production, field maintenance, and final disposal. They are the guardians of the doctrine of applied power: any resource, any idea, any human life, can and must be channelled towards increasing the destructive capacity of the Empire.

valores.title: Family Values
valores.content_1: The Armstrongs revere a secular trinity: Strength, Efficiency, and Utility. They believe that brute power, correctly directed, is history's ultimate argument and the basis of all legitimate authority. They value constant innovation, but only if it leads to greater robustness or superior lethality. They despise weakness in materials and weakness in character with equal intensity.
valores.content_2: For them, loyalty to the Empire is not a patriotic sentiment, but the logical consequence of serving the entity that best applies their philosophy. An Armstrong would betray his family before signing off on a flawed design, for they consider an engineering error to be a stain on honour that lasts for centuries, whereas treason is a matter resolved with a gunshot.

info.title: Key Information
info.content_1: The Overlord Error: The catastrophic explosion of the "Overlord" Guardian prototype not only killed William Armstrong's youngest son but also fractured the soul of the house. The incident, privately and bitterly attributed to a batch of inferior quality steel supplied by House Vickers, an accusation never proven but never forgotten, transformed the Armstrongs' ambition into a paranoid obsession with redundancy, exhaustive testing, and quality at any cost.
info.content_2: The Reluctant Heir: Edgar Armstrong, the designated heir, is a thermodynamic genius whose mind sees engines where his father sees weapons. He despises the military application of his art, secretly longing to revolutionise civil transport or energy. This ideological weakness is an open secret that causes constant tensions with William and arouses concern in the Imperial Council regarding the martial future of the house.
info.content_3: The Iron Daughter: Oliviere Armstrong, the youngest daughter, is the living incarnation of the family values carried to their logical extreme. Recruited personally by Norland for the Norland Knights, she has transcended the forge to become a living weapon. Although her membership in the imperial elite is the highest public honour, in private it represents a painful paradox for William: his greatest success as a father is also his greatest failure, for his daughter now belongs more to the Emperor than to House Armstrong, a loss he attributes, with a dull resentment, to Norland himself.

biografia.title: Biography
biografia.content_1: William Armstrong was born the heir to a dynasty of blacksmiths and hydraulic engineers; from childhood, his world was one of brute forces tamed by intelligence: the pressure of steam, the resistance of steel, the geometry of power. His genius was not theoretical, but visceral; he understood that the greatness of a nation was measured in the calibre of its cannons and the robustness of its machines. With a will that rivalled that of the hydraulic presses he admired, he transformed the modest family workshop into the colossal complex of the Elswick Ordnance Company.
biografia.content_2: His alliance with Norland Reaventhorn was natural and inevitable. Both shared a religious contempt for incompetence and obtuse tradition. In Norland's vision, William saw the definitive opportunity: an empire that would not only use his weapons but be founded upon the principles of their creation. He was the technical-military pillar of the coup, the man who guaranteed that the new era was born with fire superiority already assured. However, his iron trajectory was shattered by the explosion of the "Overlord" prototype. The death of his youngest son was not merely a personal tragedy; it was a catastrophic failure in his own design. This event transformed his ambition into a sombre obsession, and sealed within his heart a cold and incandescent rancour towards House Vickers, whom he eternally blames for providing the treacherous steel.

filosofia.title: Philosophy and Vision
filosofia.content_1: His philosophy is reduced to an immutable principle: applied power is the only truth. He believes that progress, security, and even morality are by-products of force deployed with relentless efficiency. The death of his youngest son did not soften his vision; it made it fanatic. He now believes that weakness is not an accident, but a capital sin against the natural order. His obsession with redundancy, exhaustive testing, and over-engineering is a ritual of atonement and a fortification against chaos.
filosofia.content_2: To him, the Empire of Aevora is the ultimate machine, and his function is to be the smith who ensures that every cog, every weld, and every spark of steam is up to the task of withstanding the titanic pressures of imperial destiny.

fisico.title: Physical Appearance
fisico.content_1: William Armstrong embodies authority and the essence of massiveness. His figure, tall and broad, still retains the powerful constitution of the blacksmith he was in his youth. His face is a sculpted map of decades of critical decisions, with deep wrinkles that narrate his history.
fisico.content_2: A constant patina of soot and fine oil seems to cling to his skin, an olfactory reminder of the forge that accompanies him always. A twisted purple scar, the legacy of the "Overlord", crosses his scalp to the left temple, a physical reminder of his single and devastating design error. His hands are authentic monuments to calluses and knuckles deformed by old impacts, but, paradoxically, they are capable of extreme precision.
fisico.content_3: However, it is his gaze that commands respect and silence. His eyes, the colour of the coldest, tempered steel, do not focus on people; they measure and evaluate. They ceaselessly scan everything in their path in search of solidity, balance, and potential points of failure, treating the world like a prototype subjected to a stress test.

biografia.title: Biography
biografia.content_1: Edgar Armstrong grew up immersed in the clamorous and burning forge his father had created. Although he inherited the genius of his lineage, his intellect was oriented towards a different form of harmony: the precision of thermodynamic equations and the flow of pure energy. Instead of the controlled chaos of weapons of war, Edgar sought efficiency. He was a child prodigy, rapidly surpassing his masters; his precise mind was capable of deciphering the deepest mysteries of Aevar. However, while William only saw the potential for a more powerful projectile, Edgar calculated the efficiency of an engine capable of linking continents.
biografia.content_2: The explosion of the "Overlord" and the death of his younger brother did not harden his heart; they broke it in a different way. He did not see a technical error to be amended with more violence, but the ultimate proof of the horror to which his family's martial obsession led. Although he is the silent architect behind the Empire's most advanced propulsion systems, every achievement tastes like ash to him. His genius is at the service of a war machine he despises in the depths of his soul, and his greatest torment is knowing that without his work, the Empire would grind to a halt, yet his hunger for knowledge prevents him from stopping.

filosofia.title: Philosophy and Vision
filosofia.content_1: To him, Aevar is not the soul of a weapon, but the key to a future of abundance. He envisions a world transformed by the clean and omnipresent energy of the mineral: cities illuminated without smoke, trains traversing oceans over bridges of stable steam, industries that liberate man from brutalising labour instead of enslaving him to the production of more tools of death.
filosofia.content_2: He considers war, and the military-industrial complex his family leads, as the most primitive and wasteful application possible of the Aevar miracle. A waste of resources, of intellect, and, above all, of lives. His loyalty to the Empire is not born of ideological fervour, but of a cold sense of duty and the gilded trap in which he lives; he knows that his family, his position, and the lives of those who depend on him are inextricably linked to the machine he abhors.

fisico.title: Physical Appearance
fisico.content_1: Edgar Armstrong is the physical negation of the Armstrong ideal. Thin and of average height, his posture is perpetually stooped, whether over a drawing board, a book of dense formulae, or in a gesture of unconscious defence.
fisico.content_2: His clothes, though of good quality, are always dishevelled and bear the marks of his trade: stains of indelible ink on his fingers and cuffs, small acid holes in his laboratory jacket, a sheen of fine oil on his trousers. His hands, long and fine, are skilled with the compass and the quill, but lack the scars and calluses that are his father's medals.
fisico.content_3: His gaze is his most defining feature: eyes of a piercing and intense green, which rarely settle on the interlocutor. They tend to get lost in the distance, following trajectories of imaginary particles or calculating energy losses in hypothetical systems. In his gaze there is no trace of William's steely and evaluating grey; there is the restless gleam of one who sees wonders and horrors that others are incapable of even imagining.

biografia.title: Biography
biografia.content_1: Oliviere Armstrong forged her character not in the comfort of drawing rooms, but in the din of the Elswick Ordnance testing grounds. Her first toy was a steam rifle which, at the age of ten, she was already capable of dismantling and reassembling. Unlike her brother Edgar, absorbed in the elegance of theoretical thermodynamics, Oliviere was drawn to the smell of cordite, the roar of the tests, and the palpable power of the machinery.
biografia.content_2: The loss of her younger brother in the "Overlord" catastrophe did not break her with grief; rather, it crystallised an unwavering purpose: not only to master the technology that had failed, but to be that technology, thus eradicating any possibility that a design flaw might ever again cost a family life.
biografia.content_3: This mixture of technical fervour and almost mystical contempt for personal risk captured the attention of Norland Reaventhorn. He saw in her not merely a talented engineer, but the ideal prototype for his most ambitious project: a new archetype of soldier where will, flesh, and machine converged. Her induction into the Norland Knights was not a simple promotion, but a genuine transfiguration.
biografia.content_4: Now, under the name Sir Oliviere Armstrong, her supreme loyalty is to the Emperor, superseding that of her own lineage. To the Empire, she is living proof of human evolution. To her father, William, Oliviere is the lost daughter, a masterpiece he forged but who now belongs to another master, a constant reminder of Norland's power to claim even that which an Armstrong considers irrevocably theirs.

filosofia.title: Philosophy and Vision
filosofia.content_1: To her, the family philosophy of applied power reaches its peak not in the external machine, but in the biotechnological fusion of the human with the instrument. She believes that the logical destiny of Armstrong engineering is to transcend the forge and merge with its creation: the Knight does not pilot a Guardian; the Knight is the Guardian.
filosofia.content_2: She considers the visions of her father and brother as lower rungs on the same ladder. The true revolution, she insists, is internal: using Aevar not to fuel cannons or trains, but to rewrite human biology, creating a new caste of beings, stronger, faster, more loyal, and more efficient. Her loyalty to Norland is absolute because he is the only one who shares and permits this extreme vision.

fisico.title: Physical Appearance
fisico.content_1: Oliviere Armstrong embodies the aesthetic of personal power, a fusion of flesh and steel. Her physique, tall, athletic, and with defined musculature, is indispensable for her Knight uniform and a testament to her iron discipline and the subtle modifications granted by the Aevar Infusion. She possesses the innate elegance of the nobility, but reoriented towards a utilitarian and lethal purpose.
fisico.content_2: Her face, with high cheekbones and a firm jawline, is an example of absolute control. She rarely shows emotion, as if feelings were inefficient variables. Her eyes, of a glacial blue-grey, hold a milky and opalescent sheen, the unmistakable mark of constant exposure to refined Aevar and its full integration into her nervous system. Her jet-black hair is cut in a rigorously practical manner, flush with the neck, with no concessions to fashion.
fisico.content_3: Even when not on full duty, she is never separated from her armour. She always carries a distinctive element or her auxiliary face mask, which rests upon her chest like an omen of imminent death. Her movements are silent and measured, but radiate a palpable tension.

lovelace.title: Lovelace House
lovelace.subtitle: Nothing can be hidden from an unyielding gaze.

fundacion.title: Foundation
fundacion.content_1: House Lovelace was not built; it was inherited, layer upon layer of centuries of service, secrets, and silent access to power. Their lineage is one of the oldest in England, forged not in pitched battles, but in the private corridors of palaces and in the shadows of thrones. For generations, they were the discreet guardians, the stewards of royal secrets, the men and women who knew where the keys were kept-both to the doors and to the scandals. Their honour resided in being the living memory and discretion of the monarchy.
fundacion.content_2: However, Alistair Lovelace, the current patriarch, was a man whose loyalty was conditioned by efficacy, not tradition. From his privileged position as Head of Royal Security, he did not see the grandeur of the Crown, but its institutional decadence, its inability to adapt to the roar of the new industrial age. When Norland Reaventhorn extended his hand, he did not offer bribes, but irrefutable logic: the opportunity to cease being the guardian of a museum to become that of an Empire. Alistair did not betray out of vulgar ambition, but out of cold conviction; he preferred to serve the future than to console the past.

papel.title: Role in the Coup
papel.content_1: The Lovelaces were the clockwork mechanism that allowed the machinery of the coup to assemble in silence. While other houses prepared explosions or sabotage, the Lovelaces executed the perfect sabotage: that of information and the Crown's trust. From within the royal apparatus, they deactivated security protocols, redirected vital communications, and mapped every room, every tunnel, and every doubtful loyalty within the palace.
papel.content_2: On the night of the regicide, their role was culminating and symbolic. It was Lord Alistair Lovelace in person who, exercising the authority of his office, escorted a trusting Queen Victoria and her family directly to the trap laid in Yorkshire. There was no struggle, nor alarm, only the impeccable execution of a protocol by the man most trusted to prevent it. This betrayal was not an act of violence, but of political surgery; they excised the heart of the old regime with the hands that had always protected it, demonstrating that the true key to power is not force, but access.

funcion.title: Function in the Empire
funcion.content_1: The Lovelaces are the Imperial Watchmen; they oversee the entire apparatus of internal security, intelligence, counter-espionage, and ideological surveillance of the Empire. They manage the Imperial Eye Network, the telegraphic and informant nervous system that monitors every heartbeat of society, from the High Columns to the mines of the Outcasts.
funcion.content_2: Furthermore, they are the custodians of memory and appearances. They are in charge of the adoption and upbringing of the Emperor's nephew and niece (William and Sophia Reaventhorn), a ceremonial responsibility that is, in reality, a long-range control operation over Norland's own lineage. Their ultimate function is to ensure that no idea, no conspiracy, and no subversive sentiment germinates without being detected, catalogued, and, if necessary, eradicated.

valores.title: Family Values
valores.content_1: The Lovelaces revere duty above loyalty. To them, loyalty is a fickle and dangerous sentiment; duty is a cold algorithm towards the most stable and efficient system available. They believe that the survival of the State is the supreme good, and any personal oath must be subordinate to it.
valores.content_2: They value secrecy, discretion, and insight above bravery or brute force. They despise incompetence and, above all, naivety. They consider a lack of vision-the inability to see the subterranean currents of power-as the capital sin. Their honour no longer resides in fidelity to a person, but in the impassive perfection with which they guarantee the perpetuity of the Empire.

info.title: Key Information
info.content_1: The Illicit Heir: Cornelius Lovelace, publicly recognised as Alistair's youngest son, is the fruit of the secret romance between Norland Reaventhorn and Lady Eleanor Lovelace. This young man, unaware of his true parentage, is observed with a distant and analytical attention by the Emperor.
info.content_2: The Network of Shadows: Beyond the bureaucratic Eye Network, the Lovelaces operate a clandestine organisation known as "The Shadows". It is their arm specialised in the silent and traceless elimination of internal threats, regardless of social stratum. The Shadows do not exist in any record, and their loyalty seems to float in a limbo between House Lovelace and the direct will of the Emperor.
info.content_3: Lady Eleanor's Double Loyalty: Lady Eleanor Lovelace is the enigma at the centre of the house. Her true loyalty is a secret so well-kept that neither her husband Alistair nor her children can decipher it. It is possible that her ultimate loyalty is not to her house, nor to her husband, and not even to the Emperor.

biografia.title: Biography
biografia.content_1: Alistair Lovelace, heir to a deeply loyal nobility, grew up immersed in English high society, receiving a dual education: on one hand, diplomacy, courtly protocol, and the chivalric code. On the other, the shadowy art of state security, espionage, and the management of secrets. This education taught him to decode not only texts, but also the hidden intentions behind silences and glances.
biografia.content_2: However, unlike his ancestors, Alistair ceased to see a sacred duty and began to see a mere system. As Head of Royal Security, he soon identified the profound flaws of this system. Every management error and every ignored threat reinforced his conviction: the organism he served was in a phase of terminal decay.
biografia.content_3: It was then that Norland Reaventhorn presented himself, speaking to him in the only language Alistair respected: that of implacable rationality and long-term strategy. Norland did not tempt him with riches, but with the project of a new State, a mechanism where sentimentality would be replaced by efficiency, and controlled progress would supplant traditional chaos. For Alistair, the decision was not a simple choice between loyalty and treason, but a dilemma between clinging to a corpse or being the midwife to a new order. The surrendering of the Queen, whom he had sworn to protect, was not an impulsive act, but the cold conclusion of a rational calculation.

filosofia.title: Philosophy and Vision
filosofia.content_1: For him, honour and loyalty are not virtues in themselves, but mere tactical tools. Their value lies solely in their capacity to promote the stability and efficiency of the system. He maintains that emotions are the greatest obstacle to good governance, as they introduce an unpredictable variable that disrupts the pure logic of power.
filosofia.content_2: He conceives the Empire of Aevora as precision machinery on a continental scale. In this vision, the value of every citizen is defined by their function as a cog. The State acts as the "omniscient watchmaker", whose function is to supervise, maintain, and, if necessary, discard any defective component. His disdain for the old nobility is not motivated by envy, but because he considers them useless and purely decorative pieces, the residue of an already obsolete design.

fisico.title: Physical Appearance
fisico.content_1: Alistair Lovelace is the incarnation of a silent and dense authority; despite his average height and slight build, his presence imposes itself through the solidity of his character, not his physical size. His posture is of a natural uprightness, that of someone accustomed to the immobility of prolonged observation.
fisico.content_2: His face, of a notable pallor, is a work of precise and sharp features, as if chiselled by the accumulation of silent judgments. The most dominant feature is his gaze: light grey eyes, absolutely calculating and piercing, which rarely blink and seem to capture light rather than reflect it. Everything about him reflects a meticulous order, from his greying hair, separated by a rigorous side parting, to his fine moustache, perfectly trimmed.
fisico.content_3: His attire is of a measured and deliberately old-fashioned elegance, with every element charged with symbolism. On his waistcoat, a pocket watch replaces conventional hands with tiny, gleaming Aevar gears. He is inseparable from his ebony cane, an accessory that transcends its function, whose silver handle bears the engraving of the Eye of Aevar.

biografia.title: Biography
biografia.content_1: Cornelius Lovelace has led a double life from the cradle; he is the legitimate youngest son of House Lovelace and, unknowingly, the secret scion of the Emperor. His adoption alongside his cousins, William and Sophia Reaventhorn, following the execution of their biological parents, was presented as an act of loyalty and mercy. But in Alistair Lovelace's cold economy of power, it was a masterstroke: consolidating control over the Emperor's collateral lineage and providing his house with a blood link to the throne.
biografia.content_2: He grew up in the watched opulence of the Lovelaces, where the code of family duty and discretion was instilled in him. However, his character was forged not in the drawing rooms of intrigue, but in his loyal and fierce friendship with his adoptive cousin, Leonard Reaventhorn. In Leonard, Cornelius found an authenticity and pure martial capacity lacking in his world of whispers and protocols. He followed him into the army, not out of family obligation, but out of genuine admiration and a desire to prove himself outside the shadow of his surname.
biografia.content_3: His rise was meteoric, driven by the privilege of his name and the powerful shadow of his elder brother, Cassian, a Norland Knight. But every rank, every privilege, reminded him of the paradox of his existence: his success was attributed to lineage, whilst his deepest loyalty belonged to a man who had renounced all lineage. Posted to the Eastern Front, his mission in Japan is not merely military; it is not just an elegant exile, but a way to keep him useful yet removed from the epicentre of power.

filosofia.title: Philosophy and Vision
filosofia.content_1: He internalised the family doctrine that order and stability are the supreme goods, the only ones that justify sacrifice and perpetual vigilance. He believes in the Empire as a necessary force in a chaotic world.
filosofia.content_2: However, his philosophy fractures and reforms through the lens of his friendship with Leonard. In him, Cornelius sees the embodiment of a principle nobler than mere lineage: pure merit. His loyalty to Leonard transcends family politics; it is a loyalty of man to man, based on demonstrated capability and trust forged in adversity. This places him in silent conflict with the colder values of his house and, especially, with his brother Cassian.
filosofia.content_3: His vision of the Empire is, therefore, contradictory. On one hand, he defends its structure as the guarantor of order. On the other, he secretly yearns for that order to recognise and reward the intrinsic worth of men like Leonard over the accidents of birth. He believes that the true strength of the Empire lies not only in its Guardians and its network of spies, but in the moral and martial quality of the exceptional individuals who uphold it-a dangerously romantic thought in the ruthless pragmatism of the Empire.

fisico.title: Physical Appearance
fisico.content_1: Cornelius Lovelace possesses the athletic elegance of a high-born officer and the functional physique of a field soldier. Of average height, around 1.78 metres, his build is slender but strong, marked by military training but without the overwhelming density of a Knight. He is the figure of a cavalry leader, agile and resilient.
fisico.content_2: His appearance is a testament to his double heritage. His facial features are noble and his skin pale, a trait that betrays his lineage. His eyes, of an intense and clear blue, come from a family branch he is unaware of. His hair, of a golden blond that is almost metallic, exceeds regulation length but is always kept impeccably groomed, a symbol of his nobility to which he clings even on the battlefield.
fisico.content_3: A detail breaks the controlled perfection of his image: a thin, pale scar that crosses the left side of his neck, from just below the ear to the collarbone. It is a reminder of a youthful carelessness during fencing training, a mark that even a Lovelace can be breached.
fisico.content_4: He wears the imperial uniform with the precision of a nobleman, but is often seen with his jacket unbuttoned or his tie slightly loosened in informal settings, a small gesture of rebellion against total rigidity.

biografia.title: Biography
biografia.content_1: Cassian Lovelace was not raised; he was programmed. From his first breath, his existence was a protocol designed to perfect the ultimate function of his house: to be the all-seeing eye and the all-purifying hand. While other children played, he memorised building blueprints, studied micro-expressions, and dismantled lock mechanisms. His education was a dual immersion: in the martial arts of a spy and in the cold psychology of an inquisitor.
biografia.content_2: His initiation into the real world was the night of the coup d'état. At nineteen, he was not a mere spectator. While his father executed the master betrayal, Cassian led a clean-up team through the corridors of Westminster, ensuring that no unwanted witness, no overly loyal guard, interfered with the nascent new order. That night he felt no emotion, only the efficient satisfaction of a problem well solved.
biografia.content_3: His subsequent military career on the Scandinavian Front was a logical extension of his function. In the relentless ice, his innate coldness became an absolute advantage. His success did not go unnoticed. Norland Reaventhorn, the supreme architect, saw in him something more than a loyal soldier; he saw an empty vessel, perfect to fill with the purest essence of imperial duty. The Trial of the Mask of 1878 was not a test for Cassian; it was a confirmation ceremony.

filosofia.title: Philosophy and Vision
filosofia.content_1: His view of the world is binary: the Empire (order, efficiency, perpetuity) and Chaos (everything else, including doubt, compassion, and personal loyalty). To him, duty is not a virtue; it is the only permissible reality.
filosofia.content_2: He considers feelings, even family ties, as noise in the signal, glitches in the programme. He deeply despises what he catalogues as the "strategic sentimentality" of his brother Cornelius. Where Cornelius sees in Leonard Reaventhorn a brother-in-arms and a friend, Cassian sees an anomaly, a "Houseless" with exceptional talent, opaque motivations, and dangerous access to his brother's emotional heart. He watches him not out of enmity, but out of protocol. In his logic, any element that cannot be completely predicted and controlled [is a threat].
filosofia.content_3: His vision is that of the Empire as an immunological organism. He and his kind are the white blood cells, and their function is to patrol the bloodstream of the State, identifying and ruthlessly eliminating any ideological pathogen, any rebel cell, any infection of independent thought.

fisico.title: Physical Appearance
fisico.content_1: Cassian Lovelace is not simply a man, but an imposing figure, a weapon of lethal precision, comparable to an animated marble sculpture. Standing at a height touching 1.90 metres, his physique combines the innate distinction of his lineage with a dense and unnatural musculature, a direct consequence of the Aevar Infusion.
fisico.content_2: His face appears to have been carved, with sharp features and a square jaw. The most striking feature is his pale, almost cadaverous and cold skin, which reveals faint bluish veins a side effect of the mineral's use. This pallor is complemented by an unsettling gaze: his eyes are milky, opalescent spheres that radiate a faint phosphorescence of their own. His jet-black hair is shaved close on the sides and kept short on top.
fisico.content_3: His clothing reflects absolute austerity and a rejection of vanity. Outside of his combat armour, he limits himself to wearing the uniform of the Norland Knights or civilian clothes of a rigorous, dark cut.

biografia.title: Biography
biografia.content_1: Her origin is a void carefully wiped from all records. There is no clear lineage, no family of origin, nor any verifiable past prior to her appearance in London high society in the mid-1840s. Some rumours whisper that she might have been a colonial heiress of recent fortune; others, that she was an artist or a continental intellectual who adopted a new identity. The only certainty is that she burst onto the scene with a grace and insight that disarmed even the most cynical.
biografia.content_2: It was at one of the tedious court receptions that she caught the attention of Alistair Lovelace, then a young and ascetic Royal Security officer. While others sought his favour for his handsome appearance, she was the only one who seemed to see past his uniform, interrogating him with stinging intelligence about the mechanisms of power he studied so closely. It was not a romance of passion, but of mutual recognition between two cold intellects.
biografia.content_3: Alistair, the man who analysed everything, could not or would not-analyse the void in Eleanor's past. He took her as his wife, incorporating her enigma into England's oldest heritage. Their union was a pact of minds, a marriage that added yet another layer of depth to the already opaque House Lovelace.

filosofia.title: Philosophy and Vision
filosofia.content_1: Eleanor Lovelace's philosophy is a closed book. Her vision of the Empire, of her husband, and even of herself, is inaccessible territory. She demonstrates impeccable outward loyalty towards Alistair and the regime, but never expresses an ideological opinion of her own. On the rare occasions she speaks in public, her words are measured, ambiguous, and perfectly orthodox, as if reciting a script written by another.
filosofia.content_2: The only glimpse of a personal moral compass is revealed in her relationship with her children. With Cassian, there is a respectful coldness, as if she were observing the masterpiece she helped create. With Cornelius, her youngest son, a more tangible warmth is perceived, a fierce and silent protection that contrasts with her habitual detachment.

fisico.title: Physical Appearance
fisico.content_1: Eleanor Lovelace possesses a beauty that does not seek the spotlight, but manifests in a subtle and whispering elegance, drawing the eye precisely because of her discretion. Of average height and slender build, her appearance is of impeccable neatness, though deliberately devoid of any trait that might make her memorable. Her serene and proportionate features contrast with the harder edges of her husband and the spectral intensity of her son, Cassian.
fisico.content_2: Her hair, of an immaculate dark chestnut, is always gathered in a simple low bun, devoid of flashy ornaments. Her eyes, of an elusive grey-green, possess a reflective quality: they absorb the details of their surroundings without revealing anything of their interior. She dresses exclusively in Victorian haute couture, but always in a palette of muted tones: charcoal greys, moss greens, or dark blues. Ostentatious jewellery is absent from her attire.
fisico.content_3: Eleanor's most defining characteristic is, ironically, her seclusion. She rarely ventures outside the walls of the Lovelace manor or inescapable official receptions. She is not seen on walks in the park, attending the opera, or travelling. This self-imposed life, justified by pretexts of fragile health and a reserved temperament, has been the source of countless rumours for decades. In a household already shadowed by mystery, Eleanor has become the perfect shadow.

ejercito.title: Structure of the Imperial Army
ejercito.intro_p1: Under the grey sky of Aevora, where the smoke of the foundries clouds the horizon and steam sets the rhythm of existence, rises a pyramid of steel and obedience: The Steam Legion. This is not a standard army; it is not a collection of men with weapons, but a single organism, meticulously designed to be the perfect extension of the imperial will. Every soldier, every officer, every machine is a conscious cog within a greater machinery whose sole purpose is to maintain, expand, and perpetuate the order of Norland Reaventhorn.
ejercito.intro_p2: The structure knows no improvisation. It is cold, calculated, and hierarchical, reflecting in its own organisation the social philosophy of the Empire: everyone in their place, every function assigned, every movement supervised. From the anonymous recruit to the Knight piloting a metal colossus, all answer to the same doctrine, inhale the same steam, and march in unison to the same metallic drum.

soldados.title: Private Soldiers
soldados.content_1: At the foundations of the Steam Legion lies the disciplined mass of the Private Soldiers. They are not heroes with names, nor volunteers moved by romantic ideals. They are, mostly, products of the system: labourers of exemplary performance, young technicians of proven loyalty, or sons of loyal families whose destiny was sealed in the Instruction of Duty. Their individuality dissolves in the Iron Fields, training complexes that resemble factories of human beings more than anything else.
soldados.content_2: Here, the recruit leaves his name behind. He becomes a unit number, just another face under an identical helmet. His training is a process of dismantling and reassembly: they learn to strip a compressed steam rifle with their eyes closed, to march for hours under the acid rain of the industrial districts, to obey orders without blinking. Controlled exposure to low doses of Aevar vapour during training not only strengthens their bodies but begins the subtle chemical conditioning that dulls critical thought and increases suggestibility.
soldados.content_3: Their equipment is functional and deadly: breech-loading steam rifles, light armour of overlapping plates that protect vital organs without restricting mobility, and respiratory masks with activated carbon filters that become a second skin on the battlefield. They do not fight for glory or for country; they fight for the Empire, for the stability it represents, and for the extra ration their families will receive if they survive. When they fall, their bodies are incinerated in the Mausoleums of Duty and their ashes, mixed with sacred steam, are symbolically reintegrated into the productive cycle of Aevar. Their death is, above all, useful.

mandos.title: Command Cadres
mandos.content_1: Above the homogeneous mass of soldiers operate the Command Cadres. These officers are the tendons that bind the will of the Imperial Council to the brute force of the troops. They do not reach their position by birth, but by coldly evaluated merit: they are the soldiers who showed unquestionable obedience, the technicians who demonstrated analytical coolness under pressure, the born strategists who understand Norland's doctrine not as a dogma, but as an operations manual.
mandos.content_2: Their training is more intellectual, but no less strict. They study mechanised combat tactics, supply logistics in hostile territory, and, above all, the psychology of control. They are responsible for the ideological health of their units. A soldier who doubts is a flaw in the system, and the Command Cadre member who does not detect and report him to the Eye Network is as guilty as the dissident.
mandos.content_3: On their uniform, always visible, they bear engraved or embroidered the Eye of Aevar. It is not a simple emblem; it is a constant reminder. It reminds them that they are watched by their superiors, but also reminds their subordinates that every glance, every gesture, every word whispered in the trench, is recorded. They are simultaneously leaders and gaolers, the embodiment of the horizontal surveillance that keeps the Legion cohesive.

knights.title: Knights
knights.content_1: Beyond the Command Cadres lies the elite: the Knights. This is not a rank earned solely through discipline or tactical intelligence. It requires something more: an unshakeable mental stability, a loyalty that has been tested in crucibles of fire, and, finally, the will to submit to the Aevar Infusion.
knights.content_2: This ritual is the frontier between the human soldier and the perfected imperial instrument. In pressurised chambers, the candidate inhales highly refined Aevar vapour under medical supervision of House Pelwright. The process is agonising and transformative. The Aevar fuses with their physiology, boosting their strength, accelerating their reflexes, and sharpening their senses to superhuman levels. The price is paid in the body: their eyes acquire a milky and opalescent sheen, and in cold environments, a faint vapour emanates from their skin, a sign of the energy that now boils within.
knights.content_3: Knights are the only ones authorised to pilot the Guardians, the mechanised colossi that are the symbol of Aevorian might. The connection between Knight and machine is not merely mechanical; it is almost symbiotic. The Infusion allows them to withstand the brutal G-forces and process the avalanche of sensory data from the Guardian. A Knight without his machine is a formidable weapon; a Guardian without its Knight is a heap of inert metal. Together, they are the ultimate expression of Norland's military doctrine: the fusion of will, biology, and technology in a single instrument of war.

norland_knights.title: Norland Knights
norland_knights.intro_p1: Above all, even above the most decorated Knights, exists a circle within the circle: the Norland Knights. They are not part of the traditional chain of command; they are the Emperor's left hand, a tool of absolute precision that answers solely to Norland Reaventhorn. Their creation was an act of personal will by the sovereign, and their existence sends a clear message to the Founding Houses: above their private armies and their intrigues, there is a superior, incorruptible, and lethal power.
norland_knights.intro_p2: Access to this corps is the Trial of the Mask, a test that is a filter, a ritual, and torture. Aspirants, whether promising heirs of the Houses or legendary Knights, are subjected to an exhaustive evaluation of their history, psychology, and physiology. The culminating moment is exposure in a hermetic chamber to concentrations of pure Aevar vapour bordering on the lethal. Only those whose cellular constitution resists without developing the Marking survive. Those who triumph receive a metal mask fitted to their face, an artefact that regulates the flow of Aevar in their body and certifies their new status: they are no longer completely human; they are something more and something less, instruments dedicated in body and soul to the imperial design.
norland_knights.intro_p3: Each Norland Knight possesses a unique Guardian Mark IV, a masterpiece of engineering custom-made for them. They operate on missions where failure is not an option: strategic assassinations, elimination of internal threats, conquest of impossible objectives. Their mere presence on a front means that the Emperor's eye is upon that battle, and his will is about to prevail. They are the final embodiment of Aevorian power: absolute efficiency at the service of an iron will.

rangos.title: Ranks
rangos.content_2: Supreme leader of the Norland Knights and direct representative of the Emperor. Acts as the ultimate authority within the corps and oversees both internal operations and the execution of imperial orders. Their real identity and house of origin remain classified information for reasons of strategic security.
rangos.content_8: Heir to House Lovelace. Specialist in covert operations and the surgical elimination of threats. His role within the corps focusses on infiltration, obtaining sensitive intelligence, and neutralising priority targets.
rangos.content_10: Heir to House Pelwright. Specialist in chemical weaponry and advanced manipulation of Aevar. Supervises projects related to experimental weapons and biological containment protocols.
rangos.contetn_12: Origin unknown. Specialist in siege weaponry and the tactical deployment of heavy artillery. Her Guardian is adapted for prolonged operations and long-duration attacks. Principal coordinator of siege troops.
rangos.content_14: Head of a minor house in service to the Cunards. Specialist in maritime combat, naval manoeuvres, and deployment in oceanic scenarios. Principal coordinator of the imperial fleets.
rangos.content_16: The youngest of the Armstrong family and the most recent addition. Specialist in ground weaponry and heavy mechanised infantry tactics.
rangos.content_18: Heir to House Wryn, historically subordinate to House Lovelace. Specialist in close-quarters combat and direct engagement, considered one of the best duellists in the corps.
rangos.content_20: The youngest member of the Vickers and the youngest amongst the Norland Knights. Specialist in long-range weaponry and precision systems.

ascenso.title: Ascent within the Corps
ascenso.intro: In a system built on cold meritocracy and efficiency, ascent within the Norland Knights is a deliberate and often ruthless process. There is no room for dynastic inheritances or political favours. Only two paths exist, both paved with extreme testing and risk.

sucesion.title: Formal Succession
sucesion.content_1: When a rank becomes vacant (due to death, degradation, or disintegration), a strict protocol is activated:
sucesion.content_2: First, the vacancy is announced only within the circle of the Norland Knights and, occasionally, to ordinary Knights of exceptional performance.
sucesion.content_3: Second, the Council of the Norland Knights, composed of the highest-ranking members, secretly evaluates the aspirants. They examine every detail: record of successful missions, mental stability in reports from House Lovelace, efficiency in the use of their Guardian, and absolute loyalty, measured in deeds, not words.
sucesion.content_4: Finally, promotion is not decided by simple majority, but by unanimous consensus. a single veto from a Council member is sufficient to discard a candidate. This rule ensures that the promoted individual is accepted by the entire hierarchy as a capable equal, avoiding internal rifts. The chosen one is informed in private by the Silver Hand, and their new mask (bearing the marks of their new rank) is presented in a ceremony with no external witnesses.

desafio.title: The Challenge
desafio.intro: It is the most dangerous and respected method, a controlled vestige of combat for power that reflects the Empire's philosophy of fierce competition. Any Norland Knight may challenge a direct superior to a "Trial of Competence".
desafio.regla: The challenge must be submitted in writing to the Silver Hand, specifying the disputed rank and the nature of the test. It cannot be capricious; it must be based on an alleged deficiency of the superior, such as lack of tactical skill, logistical inefficiency, or weakness in their speciality.

tipos.duelo: Duel of Guardians: Combat in a testing ground. Victory demonstrates direct martial superiority.
tipos.estrategia: Strategic Test: The contenders are locked in simulation rooms and must solve a complex tactical scenario. Evaluates intellect and analytical coolness.
tipos.voluntad: Test of Will: Simultaneous and controlled exposure to critical levels of Aevar vapour, measuring physiological endurance and mental control. The first to falter or show signs of Marking loses.

desafio.consecuencia: If the challenger wins, they ascend immediately, occupying the rank of the vanquished, who is demoted. If they lose, they suffer a severe penalty, ranging from loss of privileges to, in cases of challenges perceived as reckless or insubordinate, expulsion from the corps and assignment to a penal unit. This system guarantees that leadership is always in the hands of the most capable, according to the Empire's values, and maintains a creative and lethal tension within the elite.

beneficios.title: Benefits of Rank
beneficios.intro: The benefits granted to a Norland Knight are proportional to their position, designed to maximise their efficacy and, at the same time, bind them irrevocably to the system that sustains them. They are the fuel of their loyalty and the reward for their dehumanisation.

todos.title: For all Norland Knights
todos.content_1: Priority access to supervised doses of refined Aevar of the highest purity. It is not just a supply; it is a rite. This vapour maintains their augmented capabilities and deepens their physiological dependence, ensuring that their well-being is literally tied to the health of the Empire.
todos.content_2: They enjoy an authority that transcends that of conventional military officers and minor nobles. A Norland Knight, even of entry rank, can demand cooperation from garrisons or supervise local operations in the name of the imperial interest, a phrase that opens all doors and silences most questions.
todos.content_3: Every Knight has the right to a unique Guardian Mark IV, maintained and upgraded by the best technicians of Houses Armstrong and Vickers in reserved facilities. Their machine is an extension of their rank and their martial identity.

piramide.title: Scaling the Pyramid of Privileges
piramide.content_1: Middle ranks (such as Sir Magnus Pelwright or Sir Seraphina Hale) may request the use of experimental facilities to perfect their tactics or their Guardian, coming into contact with technologies that not even the Founding Houses know in their entirety.
piramide.content_2: They are granted direct authority over elite units of the Steam Legion for specific missions. A Norland Knight may, by order, command a battalion of common Knights or a company of steam assault troops.
piramide.content_3: From the fifth highest rank upwards, a Knight not only executes orders but may be consulted in the planning of minor campaigns or special operations within their speciality. Their experience becomes a resource of the Imperial War Council.
piramide.content_4: The most feared and coveted privilege. The five highest-ranking Knights have the right to request a private audience with the Emperor Norland Reaventhorn, bypassing the Imperial Council and the bureaucracy of the Houses. It is access to the very source of power, a supreme vote of confidence that carries an equally supreme risk: wasting the Emperor's time is an error only committed once.

mano.title: Privileges of the Silver Hand
mano.content_1: The absolute apex. This Knight has no benefits; they are the benefit personified. They speak and act with the Emperor's authority when ordered. They have unlimited access to any resource, any secret, any facility. They can mobilise entire armies and issue orders to the patriarchs of the Founding Houses in matters of imperial security. Their identity, hidden from all, is the Empire's most guarded mystery. Their privilege is to be Norland's will made flesh and steel.
mano.content_2: As if this were not enough, the Silver Hand possesses another unique benefit: the Personal Dominion of a Fiefdom. They may choose, with Norland's final approval, any territory within imperial borders that is not the capital or a capital district of a Founding House. This territory becomes their personal fiefdom, free from the direct control of any House. There, their word is law. They can reorganise its economy, establish their own garrisons of Guardians loyal only to them, and direct production towards their personal projects or the Emperor's secret designs. It is a micro-empire within the Empire, a laboratory of power where the will of the Silver Hand is tested without intermediaries. This fiefdom is not hereditary; it is an extension of their office. Upon their death or dismissal, the territory and its assets are reabsorbed by the Imperial Crown, purged, and reassigned.

logistica.title: Logistics and Supplies
logistica.intro: In the Empire of Aevora, war is not won by heroes or cannons alone, but by steam conduits, pressure logs, and convoys traversing continents under eternal surveillance. Imperial logistics is a dark and sacred science, a discipline that converts the energetic advantage of Aevar into sustained military dominance. It is the circulatory system of the steel colossus, and its interruption is the only wound it truly fears.

abastecimiento.title: Aevar Supply Chain
abastecimiento.content_1: Everything begins and ends with the mineral. The supply of Aevar is not a logistical task; it is a state ritual, a deadly procession from the bowels of the earth to the combustion chambers of the Guardians.
abastecimiento.content_2: The cycle is born in the high-toxicity mines, where the Outcasts, condemned to a slow death by Marking, tear the raw mineral from the rock. These operations are isolated, sealed, and watched by guards with orders to fire at any anomaly. Efficiency here is measured in tonnes extracted per hundred lives consumed.
abastecimiento.content_3: The mineral travels in armoured convoys to the Alderfost-Pelwright refinement complexes, industrial fortresses where chemists chained to their work distill raw Aevar into its stable and potent form. Any error in pressure or temperature results not in a mere explosion, but in a cloud of toxic gas that provokes the first stages of the Marking upon mere inhalation.
abastecimiento.content_4: Refined Aevar circulates through the Empire in double-layered pressurised containers, transported in special train wagons or tanker ships that are small floating fortresses. Each container bears a unique Aevar pressure seal, an energetic signature that the Imperial Eye Network tracks in real time through the telegraphic network. A drop in pressure or a deviation from the authorised route unleashes a treason investigation.
abastecimiento.content_5: At the front, Aevar is stored in mobile cold chambers that advance with the troops. From there, specialised technicians in containment suits transfer it to the reactors of the Guardians, the steam rifles of the infantry, and camp generators. A Guardian Mark III can consume the equivalent of a minor mine's weekly production in a prolonged siege campaign.

mantenimiento.title: Technology Maintenance
mantenimiento.content_1: An Empire fighting in the Scandinavian tundra, the French plains, and the northern seas simultaneously cannot rely on fixed workshops. The answer is the Legion's Mobile Workshops, mechanised appendages that convert the battlefield into a production line.
mantenimiento.content_2: The Steel Surgeons are units, led by Custodians promoted from the Iron Rings, who follow the vanguard troops. Their mission is immediate recovery and repair. A Guardian with an articulated leg destroyed by artillery does not retreat; it is dismantled in situ. Viable parts are cannibalised, irreparable ones are melted down in portable furnaces, and critical components are replaced from an inventory tracked with bureaucratic precision.
mantenimiento.content_3: Aevar used in combat becomes contaminated with combustion residues and metal particles. Technicians use portable steam centrifuges to separate reusable mineral, a dangerous process that leaves operators with chronic tremors.
mantenimiento.content_4: Nothing is abandoned. A destroyed convoy is not a logistical disaster, but a deposit of resources to be recovered under enemy fire. This obsession with total recycling ensures that the imperial war effort can be sustained even when supply lines are stretched to the breaking point.

entrenamiento.title: Training and Conditioning
entrenamiento.intro: The Aevorian soldier is not born; he is manufactured. His creation does not occur on battlefields, but in the Iron Fields, factories of obedience where the perfect human cog for the military machine is forged. Here, the recruit does not learn to fight; he learns to be an extension of the Empire.

campos.title: The Iron Fields
campos.content_1: These complexes, often built upon old poisoned industrial zones, are universities of submission. A recruit's cycle is a process of systematic dismantling.
campos.content_2: Upon crossing the gate, the recruit surrenders his name, his possessions, and his past. He receives a number, an identical uniform, and a bunk in a dormitory vibrating with the distant rumble of steam generators. The first lesson is silence; the second, synchrony; and the third, the annulment of the self before the group.
campos.content_3: Exercise is not performed outdoors, but in chambers where low-concentration Aevar vapour is introduced into the environment. Recruits run, march, and perform calisthenics whilst inhaling the essence of the Empire. The effects are dual: they increase lung capacity and stamina, and produce a mild euphoria and docility associated with the mineral. It is the first phase of physiological dependence.
