campos.content_4: Training sessions replicate specific scenarios for future imperial conquests. Failure is not punished with shouting, but with the reduction of rations or corrective exposure to higher concentrations of vapour.
campos.content_5: Between sessions, screens project images of Guardians marching victoriously, speeches by Norland regarding efficiency and order, and history lessons where the night of the regicide is presented as the Necessary Dawn. They are taught that doubt is a manufacturing flaw, that loyalty to the Emperor is the only biological truth, and that the Outcasts are the natural consequence of weakness.

programas.title: Loyalty Programmes
programas.content_1: Physical conditioning is merely the shell. The true wiring occurs in the mind, through protocols designed to excise free will.
programas.content_2: Once a week, the unit congregates in an Affirmation Chamber. There, kneeling and masked, they inhale in unison a measured dose of refined Aevar, guided by a Political Commissar. The euphoric effect and mental clarity are explicitly associated with the Empire's grace. It is a chemical communion linking personal well-being to the State.
programas.content_3: Ideological Clarification Sessions, led by officers of House Lovelace or Command Cadres, these gatherings are autopsies of doubt. Recruits must analyse speeches, identify deviant thoughts in hypothetical examples, and denounce any glimmer of weakness in themselves or, preferably, in their comrades. Denunciation is rewarded; complicit silence is punished.
programas.content_4: Every three months, recruits are subjected to tests measuring their heart rate before images of labour unrest, their galvanic skin response upon hearing the name of Eldric Reaventhorn, and their reaction time to morally ambiguous orders. The data is sent to the Eye Network. A pattern of latent instability can mean reassignment to a penal unit, or something worse.
programas.content_5: Graduation is not a ceremony, but a bureaucratic formality and a final act of submission. Before an imperial flag and a portrait of Norland, the now private soldier swears obedience. They sign a contract binding them for life to the Imperial Army and accept that, in the event of desertion or treason, their family will be socially reassigned. Only then do they receive their definitive unit number and are sent to their destination, perfectly polished pieces for the most formidable war machine in the world.

guardians.title: Evolution of Guardians
guardians.intro: The Guardians are not mere vehicles; they are the mobile embodiment of Aevorian philosophy. Their evolution is the history of the Empire told in steel, steam, and blood.

mark_i.title: Guardian Mark I
mark_i.content_1: The Mark I was the first metallic growl of the newborn Empire. Born of the joint blueprints of Armstrong, Vickers, and Brunel, it was less a war machine and more a mobile bastion. Heavy, slow, and with an Aevar reactor that roared like a wounded beast, its design was brutally simple: advance, absorb punishment, and destroy everything in its path with short-range steam cannons and hydraulic saws capable of splitting a carriage in two.
mark_i.content_2: Its role in the early internal purges and on the Benelux Front was that of a psychological battering ram. Its appearance on the horizon, shrouded in a cloud of steam and thunderous noise, broke the morale of militias and regular soldiers alike. However, it was a giant with feet of clay. Its limited mobility made it vulnerable in complex terrain, and its unstable reactor was a time bomb that required many sacrificed technicians to master. It was the tool that opened the path, crude but unstoppable.

mark_ii.title: Guardian Mark II
mark_ii.content_1: Learning from the errors of the Mark I and facing the challenges of the Scandinavian Front, the Mark II was born. It was no longer a siege beast, but an adapted predator. Its improvements were profound: a dual-chamber reactor offering greater stability in extreme climates, reinforced joints for moving through snow and mud, and a pressure sensor system that allowed it to feel changes in the terrain.
mark_ii.content_2: Its weaponry became modular; it could swap a siege cannon for freezing steam launchers for Arctic operations. The Mark II was the workhorse of expansion, the machine that planted the banner of Aevora from the Norwegian fjords to the plains of Canada. It represented the transition from brute force to intelligent force, even if its intelligence was still purely mechanical.

mark_iii.title: Guardian Mark III
mark_iii.content_1: With the Mark III, the Guardian ceased to be a tool and became an extension of the pilot. Designed for symbiosis with Knights who had undergone the Aevar Infusion, this model was lethal elegance. Its triple-chamber reactor provided a smooth and devastating flow of energy; its composite armour, ultra-light, allowed for supernatural agility for its size; and its assisted targeting system translated the Knight's nerve impulses into shots of millimetric precision.
mark_iii.content_2: The Mark III was a whirlwind of death on the battlefield, capable of executing manoeuvres that seemed impossible. It was the symbol that the Empire's elite not only used technology, but had fused with it. Reserved for the most outstanding Knights, it was the final reward for loyalty and sacrifice.

mark_iv.title: Guardian Mark IV Prototype
mark_iv.content_1: The Mark IV Prototypes transcend the category of weapon. It is a myth manufactured in secret laboratories, a creature of legend reserved exclusively for the Norland Knights. Each unit is unique, hand-forged under the gaze of the Silver Hand, and its existence is a state secret of the highest order.
mark_iv.content_2: Its quadruple reactor is a heart of pure power, capable of feeding weapons that would consume any other Guardian. But its true horror lies in the direct-link neuro-mechanical system. It has no controls; the pilot connects via neural ports embedded in their mask. Machine and man think and react as a single entity, with a response time that defies biology.
mark_iv.content_3: Its experimental armour, christened Aevorian alloy, seems to absorb impact rather than resist it. The Mark IV does not fight; it executes. It is the Emperor's will materialised in a walking form, the final word in any debate regarding power. Seeing one in combat is, for the enemy, the last thing they will ever see.

armas.title: Steam Weapons
armas.intro: If the Guardians are the fists of the Empire, steam weapons are its claws and fangs, extending the power of Aevar to every soldier. These weapons replaced gunpowder with extreme-density compressed steam, creating a new paradigm of warfare.

ventajas.title: Advantages
ventajas.content_1: Constant and lethal power: a steam rifle is not affected by humidity or extreme cold like gunpowder. Its shot is always the same, a supersonic projectile driven by a controlled steam explosion, capable of piercing light armour at hundreds of metres. The power is such that an Aevorian steam cannon can reduce a stone fortification to rubble in a matter of hours.
ventajas.content_2: Instead of tonnes of gunpowder and bullets of different calibres, the imperial army needs only refined Aevar and inert projectiles. The same mineral feeds everything from an officer's pistol to a battleship's cannon. This creates a monomaniacal and efficient supply chain.
ventajas.content_3: Weapons are not independent objects. They connect via reinforced hoses to portable reactors soldiers carry on their backs, or feed directly from Guardian generators. An infantry platoon thus becomes a mobile power network, capable of maintaining sustained fire while moving.

limitaciones.title: Limitations
limitaciones.content_1: Without Aevar, the imperial army is an inert metal giant. This absolute dependence is its Achilles' heel. Every destroyed convoy, every sabotaged mine, is a direct blow to the heart of its war capability.
limitaciones.content_2: Steam at extreme pressures generates fierce heat. Weapons require complex cooling cycles, utilising Alderfost systems that sometimes fail. A rifle used in a prolonged firefight can become incandescent and explode, taking the soldier's hand with it.
limitaciones.content_3: An Aevorian army does not know what stealth is. The characteristic hiss of weapons recharging, the dry crack of steam discharge, and the tremendous residual heat make them beacons for enemy artillery and make furtive operations impossible.
limitaciones.content_4: The Empire's enemies have learned. Introducing certain caustic compounds into a weapon's or a Guardian's steam system can destabilise the Aevar, provoking an internal explosion or accelerated corrosion that renders the equipment useless in minutes.

costes.title: Human Costs of Progress
costes.intro: The Empire measures advancement in efficiency and territory conquered, never in ruined lives. Aevorian technology is a demanding goddess, and her altar is watered with the suffering of every social stratum.

soldados.title: Private Soldiers and Technicians
soldados.content: They are the first to inhale residual vapours, to suffer burns from superheated steam leaks, and to endure smelter's cough, a chronic lung disease caused by the inhalation of Aevar micro-particles. Their bodies wear out decades before their natural time, discarded when they can no longer maintain the machine's pace.

knights.title: Knights
knights.content: The Aevar Infusion and continuous exposure are a Faustian pact. Their superhuman strength and heightened senses are paid for with degenerative neuropathy, premature organ failure, and a dependence on the mineral that is as addictive as it is physical. The reddish hues in their eyes are only the first visible symptom of the slow internal combustion consuming them. They die young, often amidst crises of pain or steam-induced madness.

norland_knights.title: Norland Knights
norland_knights.content: They are the ones who pay the highest price. The Trial of the Mask and the link with the Mark IV accelerate their cellular degradation exponentially. It is rumoured that their life expectancy rarely exceeds a decade following their ascension. Some, near the end, begin to merge with the machine, losing the ability to distinguish where their bodies end and the Guardian begins, whispering to the steam conduits as if they answered them.

marginados.title: Outcasts
marginados.content: They are the literal fuel. Their exposure to raw Aevar in the mines turns them into Marked monsters, whose useful life is measured in weeks. When they fall, their bodies, already impregnated with the mineral, are processed to extract the last remnant of useful energy. They are the final reminder that in the Empire's economy, even death is a resource.
